website_summaries.verdict: Your best option if you're looking for a sturdy compression bag at a great price.
pros: Sturdy bag holds up well over time
Can fit a sleeping bag and other soft gear
Good quality at a price that fits comfortably into any budget
cons: Though the bag claims to be water resistant, users report that it is not

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, ended up with one broken ladder lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some 20+ year old ones I had from LL Bean that were still working but ended up going MIA after my last trip. These were much lighter weight than the old LL Bean ones, but they seemed to work fine for what I needed, which was compressing clothes (and a pillow) in my suitcase for a trip to Europe. Overall, I was very happy with their performance. However, in cranking down on the straps, one of the ladder locks broke, pretty much rendering that strap locked in place (the webbing strap won't release or tighten because of the break). Otherwise, I'd buy these again as I was happy with their performance.
customer_reviews.author: David Schwind

customer_reviews.title: Functional but mediocre quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium size, which was a great fit for a sleeping bag with room for clothes or other items. Compression worked just fine with no tearing of the straps, but then I tried to support it by the handle strap on top and the stitching quickly came undone on one side. Now I have a seam that is slowly coming open. Works for a cheap compression sack, but not good as a long term solution. PS. That is my awesome dog, Eddie, in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: worked okay for a 20 degree bag; prob better suited for clothing; i got the Medium
customer_reviews.text: its okay for the price, got it to compress my 20 degree sleeping back for a 5 day trip on the AT. The bag fit, but after the first use i could see that the stitching on the top and bottom were becoming frayed and i couldn't compress the bag all that much in favor of still having the bag somewhat usable for the remainder of the trip. you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Hale Googlezon

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL FOR A SMALL SLEEPING BAG
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover for my Boy Scout son's backpacking sleeping bag, so he can compress it the maximum amount possible. However -- this bag is too small for his sleeping bag, which is not that big. I can't imagine any sleeping bag fitting into this compression bag. We will keep it for clothes, but I have to consider getting the medium size for the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mo H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, decent quality, but lacks some features.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for value. Fair product for the price. PROS: size small just right for my 50F sleeping bag (rectangular 75 in x 33 in) 4 straps - effective for whatever compression you need good default colors CONS: size small lacks the quick release buckles that other bags have (cinch tight buckles only). this means some tangling and extra time to load and unload no built-in feature for securing the long excess strap length out of the way once bag is compressed
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Okay bag but water resistance does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: This compression sack is great but it claims it is water resistant - it is not. The material is very thin and though it may be water resistant off the factory floor - it wears rather quickly and does allow moisture in. If you are looking for a dry bag - this is not it. If you need something to compress whatever else - this works great! I expected to use it for a sleeping bag but it is a great way to story my dirty clothes while camping.
customer_reviews.author: M rux

customer_reviews.title: It's great for keeping it separate and taking up as little ...
customer_reviews.text: These aren't just for hikers or backpackers! I use them for longer trips so I can still cram everything into my carry on. At the beginning of the trip I use them for socks, underwear, undershirts and even some misc stuff that can be crammed without an issue. Then towards the middle of the trip, I swap out and cram as much laundry in the bag as I possibly can. It's great for keeping it separate and taking up as little space as possible. Never travel without one!
customer_reviews.author: I review stuff I buy

customer_reviews.title: Buckle broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: In terms of materials and stitching, this bag seems well made. The problem, though, is that one of the straps closes via a plastic buckle/clip. This buckle is far weaker than the other straps. The first time I tried to use the bag, the buckle broke as I attempted to tighten the s trap, rendering the bag basically useless. I replaced it with an REI brand compression sack, which has three adjustable straps and no buckles. The REI bag cost about $5 more, but is FAR stronger. I'd recommend getting a bag that doesn't rely on cheap plastic parts to compress your gear.
customer_reviews.author: Femme Fatale

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but so-so quality and execution
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this product as it was a good price and appeared to offer what I needed. Unfortunately, it seems that the workmanship isn't quite up to snuff. My unit came with the compression straps crossed, and inserted into the wrong "buckles", so I had to cut the straps to reconfigure them correctly, then use a lighter to melt the strap ends. The compression/strapping mechanism is not smooth, and it gets stuck easily while pulling. Most of the time cinching is a two-handed operation. It may just be my unit that has these problems
customer_reviews.author: DWah

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two compression sacks last year, in July (2018), after going camping and no longer wanting to stop sleeping bags into plastic kitchen garbage bags. I used them for the first time this year— and one of the plastic buckles broke! This means that I can’t use the compression bag for its intended purpose: you need to have all four straps functional in order to be able to tighten them evenly. Very frustrating, especially since I bought two other compression socks at the same time, from a different manufacturer, which are performing much better than these ones!
customer_reviews.author: Tanneke

customer_reviews.title: This product is great for other things like compression for clothing bath towels ...
customer_reviews.text: This product will not fit the mountain trails Allegheny sleeping bag. I bout the product this prupose and did not work out well. This product is great for other things like compression for clothing bath towels and other thing in this such nature. I wear a size ten is men's shoe
customer_reviews.author: Zuleika A. Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: These do what I need them to do but seem kind of janky. The straps are very tangly and annoying to get them all lined up before you compress. The buckle on one of them was installed backwards so the strap is twisted. Also you need to be careful to compress evenly or else the inside bag will pop out between the straps and you have to stuff it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Nice and tight
customer_reviews.text: Just what you need to squish them things down to size. I used this for an inflatable sleeping pad. I was able to really maximize the compression to save valuable storage space on my bike. I bought two and plan to use the second for cloths and such on longer trips. Seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Donald

customer_reviews.title: Usefull bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my rain gear with room to spare. I ordered the large thinking that I can always compress the bag down smaller if I don't use all the room. Works like a charm and now my rain gear/ base layers don't take up a whole side case.
customer_reviews.author: Codi Foster

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after one use. It's cheaply made and quickly destined for landfill.
customer_reviews.text: Stitching is coming apart after one use. It's cheaply made and quickly destined for landfill. The description says there is a warranty on parts for one year, but there doesn't seem to be any way to get ahold of the seller. I have scoured the listing and can't find any contact info. I purchased this in the spring for a summer trip, at which point it started falling apart after only one use. I want either a refund or a replacement with something that won't fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: skunther

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to use with her 20 degree sleeping bag on our backpacking trips. The stitching has already started to come loose after using it just once. If you're looking for a heavy duty compression bag then I would suggest you look elsewhere. We won't be buying anymore of this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Estima8tor

customer_reviews.title: The straps make it super easy. I would buy the other sizes instantly ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to compress a bulky XXL motorcycle rain suit (that would take up nearly my whole saddlebag) down to about the size of a coffee can that now only takes up about 1/3 of my saddlebag. I thought I'd need the medium but the small worked well- even with a bit of room to spare up top of the bag before it compressed. The straps make it super easy. I would buy the other sizes instantly if I thought I had a use for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Judas

customer_reviews.title: Not quite
customer_reviews.text: Received it and another brand today and loaded the sleeping bag. One of the compression buckles broke while compressing the bag. Moved to the other brand and no issues. Little disappointed yes as the material seems heavier and water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kieparski

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Not too sure on its ability to repel water, but it is going inside my waterproof backpack so not a huge issue. Compressed my clothes easily half the size they were taking up before. Do not stick small children into it and compress them down, I heard that is frowned upon.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Untangle it first.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like the picture. Didn't work well enough for me to show my wife what it was. When you take it out of the package it's just straps around some canvas that you have to untangle.
customer_reviews.author: ghostwriter

customer_reviews.title: The quality was excellent, but if you have a heavy duty sleeping ...
customer_reviews.text: Pay close attention to the dimensions of the bag. The quality was excellent, but if you have a heavy duty sleeping bag you will struggle to make this work. If you have a lightweight sleeping bag that is designed to be stuffed in a compression bag, you will be pleased. I made the mistake of not paying close attention to the dimensions. Overall, the bag is excellent for what size it is.
customer_reviews.author: Burt VanBuren

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s a great compression sack for the price. I purchased the small for my backpacking sleeping bag (Marmot Women’s Sorcerer synthetic mummy bag) and really cranked it down and so far so good. Used it on a 3 day backpacking trip and definitely didn’t baby it.
customer_reviews.author: jymcd

customer_reviews.title: Large fits a regular Coleman sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: If you have average sleeping bags with polyester filling, like the Coleman River Gorge 30° Sleeping Bag, that didn't come with a storage bag, then the large size of this bag is the only bag I have found that (1) actually fits the sleeping bag, (2) seems decent quality, and (3) isn't stupid expensive. I get best results by just rolling the sleeping bag (without first folding it in half lengthwise).
customer_reviews.author: Aeneas

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff Sack
customer_reviews.text: Currently in the military. Stuff sack is great for Army issued sleep system, it has a label on both ends, so I covered the labels with black duct tape. I have taken stuff sack to 2 field problems, though they weren’t as arduous conditions most service members might be in, I’m sure the stuff sack would be fine. Great product, very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Olmos

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: This small sized compression bag was perfect for the warm weather rated sleeping bag I took to South America. When the straps are tightened all the way it is about the size of a small watermelon. This will definitely come in handy for space saving in future camping and travel.
customer_reviews.author: S.C. Trojan

customer_reviews.title: Unrelible seems, very cheap quality, do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Unacceptable quality. During second week of bikepacking one of the bags started to have holes, seems are unrealible. Second bag is kind of ok, except the seems which are look-through now - i can see my $300 sleeping nag now.... I hope we have good weather during next two weeks till Seattle where I can buy more reliable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on the water and primitive camping
customer_reviews.text: Kept all my gear bone dry during a 3 canoe trip. It rained at times as well and everything was still dry inside the bag. Only complaint was that one of the side straps started to rip at the end of the weekend but it may have been my fault for trying to compress too much. The other size bags didn't have this issue
customer_reviews.author: PolishRifle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for my 10 year old daughter's sleeping bag. She is able to load the bag in herself and get it cinched down very small. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Batman97045

customer_reviews.title: Fits a sleeping bag easily
customer_reviews.text: This is much easier to use than the typical stuff sack included with a sleeping bag. Really helps when backpacking or camping with a motorcycle. I now have a collection of these bags
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: strong!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for compressing a sleeping bag or clothing. We bought both the medium and small to use on a Kayak trip and they worked great!. I plan on buying more for our next trip because the quality is so good for a reasonable price. They are easy to use. I was able to get my sleeping bag in the small one all by myself, and I am middle aged woman who needs help opening jars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: This bag works very well. Carried it on a 50 miler with a sleeping bag in it. Pretty easy to use and can compact things very small. The fabric looks cheap like it will tear, but it hasn't torn yet. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Layton

customer_reviews.title: It does its job and does it well
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, compact and very useful if limited space. Compresses my TETON Sports TrailHead Sleeping bag neatly and nicely thus conserving a whole lot of space when I'm flying on military jets.
customer_reviews.author: Ist

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a section hike of the AT in Vermont and I used one of these bags for my sleeping bag. It worked like a charm..no rips and no seems coming apart. Make sure you pull the cords down evenly as you can get tons of leverage on one strap. I didn't pop one but I've read other reviews on it. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Turnkey895

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay for 2 weeks in Nepal
customer_reviews.text: This feels a little cheap and lightly made. It worked well for me while trekking in Nepal -- held my sleeping bag plus my sleeping clothes. It is nice that it has one strap that unbuckles -- that feature makes it easier to get the cover on correctly, compared to another brand that has all the straps fixed -- in that case, it is very easy to get the straps tangled and hard to figure out how to untangle them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cox

customer_reviews.title: Seam  ripped after a  few uses
customer_reviews.text: I liked the functionality of this compression bag, using it on several backpacking trips for my down sleeping bag. But after maybe 4 uses the seam started to tear. I'm still using it but it will probably only last another 2 times before the seem is completely separated. And the material is fraying, so I can't really sew it again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality!
customer_reviews.text: I am planning on using this to help compress my personal clothes if I go on a Conflagration to fight wild fires, however, I did test drive it using it to go camping, and I love it! It tightens really well, I expected less because I really, really wrenched on them, and considering they are plastic buckles, I am impressed they did not snap under the pressure I put them in. Gooooooood product! Glad I bought!
customer_reviews.author: KJC#1371

customer_reviews.title: I was able to compact my bag to the size of a cantaloupe
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a small Coleman 25F hiking mummy bag. The bag I had didn't come with vertical compression cinches so I needed a way to compact it down more. This worked perfectly. I was able to compact my bag to the size of a cantaloupe. So far it has held up well. I took it on a 7 night camping trip canoeing out into the boundary waters.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma Jones

customer_reviews.title: Makes BIG things small.
customer_reviews.text: I received my Nelson-Rigg Small Compression Bag and immediately put my Teton Sports TrainHead 20F Ultralight Sleeping Bag in it and compressed it down to about the size of a large cantaloupe. I am very impressed with the build quality and functionality of this bag. I believe this is a great compression bag and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen X

customer_reviews.title: Works great - but you can't fit a sleeping bag in it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it with a caveat, you can't use this for a sleeping bag. I tried placing a Coleman Medium weight sleeping bag in here - and it's not happening. I need to order the medium compression bag for that. I will use the small bag to compress clothes to save space. I'm biking from Washington DC to Pittsburgh this summer and I'm looking to save space.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Not as robust as the compeitition.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of use traveling two of the plastic strap guides have broken. Sadly, too late for a return or exchange. Not as well built as my other compression sacks I use for international travel.
customer_reviews.author: SJRD

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficiently durable
customer_reviews.text: I own a few of this identical item and have been pleased with their performance. However, my recently purchased one busted a seam the first time I began compressing it. I’m not sure if I received a defective one or if the general quality of construction has declined since my original purchases, but it clearly wasn’t fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Seam split right after first loading
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, opened it, my husband started to stuff it and the seam split up the side. We returned it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great price for necessary backpacking gear
customer_reviews.text: Great price for necessary backpacking gear. It has a quick release on one of the straps, it adds an ounce or so of weight, but it makes it easy for my son to manage it on his Boy Scout trips. Well constructed and great value. Better than a national co-op's brand bag and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Planning a Scouts BSA Philmont trip this summer and all gear has to be packed small and light. Have a light sleeping bag and replaced its storage sack with this to minimize the space it takes. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jer j.

customer_reviews.title: Useful, Nice construction
customer_reviews.text: best buy ever, just traveled to Europe and Asia with my backpack and this was just the space saver that I wanted, allowed me to compress my dirty clothes and made space for souvenirs, so I and my family are happy, good construction, good materials, nice product
customer_reviews.author: Fer el Cliente de Mamazon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not as well made as my ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but not as well made as my similarly sized ALPS bag that was comparable in price. I both bags to store identical sleeping bags while backpacking. This bag compresses well.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: They barely fit in the stuff sack so the compression ratio is worse than with my clothes
customer_reviews.text: I've got two woobies stuffed in this. One Jungle Blanket, one military surplus poncho liner. They barely fit in the stuff sack so the compression ratio is worse than with my clothes, but it's a good sack!
customer_reviews.author: P. Daw

customer_reviews.title: It compresses.
customer_reviews.text: Good compression bag at a good price. Used it for my down sleeping bag, and was able to compress the bag to about 50% of what the manufacturer's "compression" sack did. (OK, the manufacturer's sack was not a compression sack, just a small bag) Regardless, this does a good job overall, at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: CBMTTek

customer_reviews.title: Pack it up, pack it in
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing just how much you can stuff into one of these things. Packed a full down 20 degree sleeping bag in one, and compressed it to the size of a Nalgene bottle. Pretty amazing. Appears to be pretty durable, but time will tell 5 stars for the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke third use.
customer_reviews.text: I figured it would break, but it happened a little quicker than I suspected. It's still usable, but pretty lame. I imagine if you babied it a bit more it would last longer. I'm gonna go ahead and shell out the extra $15 this time and get a better one. Sorry Nelson, I gave it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: deeks

customer_reviews.title: Good bag... question longevity
customer_reviews.text: So far i give it 4 stars. -1 because it seems cheap. This size will not fit a sleeping bag, so go for the medium if thats what you are getting for. Compresses just as it should. My concern is that the seams look like they are straining when cranked down. will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Tcapre

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time for camping and back packing! they work great!
customer_reviews.author: caitlin smith

customer_reviews.title: Much better quality than I was expecting for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The same size and quality fabric and stitching, at the local outdoor store is >$30. Fits my entire sleep system, from hammock, rain fly to insulation. plus accessories compressed down to the size of a basketball.
customer_reviews.author: Rneck

customer_reviews.title: Saved space but leaks water fast.
customer_reviews.text: Worked good to save space but not very water resistant at all. We got a light rain for a few hours while hiking in the Smokey mountains and when we unpacked at camp these things leaked through soaking our sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: M.Dtown.W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pack a green bag from the MSS sustem in and it fits perfectly. This is my second one of these.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not - this large bag holds our 10 person tent and rain fly (not the poles). We literally stuffed it in and cinched it down. Don't get me wrong...It's full and there is no room for more (!!!) but I am amazed at space we were able to save using this bag! We will be investing in other sizes very soon!
customer_reviews.author: 8Legs & 24paws

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The stuff sack has very few points of failure possible, but the cheap plastic used on the straps didnt survive the 2nd compression. So now I've got a sack that doesn't compress.
customer_reviews.author: Rocc

customer_reviews.title: ... 5 stars just because I couldn't say that "I love it" about a piece of camping gear
customer_reviews.text: Didn't give it 5 stars just because I couldn't say that "I love it" about a piece of camping gear. Works very nicely though. Light weight, well constructed. Been using it for a couple of years now.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, just watch the size.
customer_reviews.text: Got two medium bags and they work great for my sleeping bag. I think I'll get a couple of small for other items like clothes. Would have been nice to know what the sizes worked for. The Medium's I got were just right for sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: When I just opened this, I thought no way my son’s sleeping bag would fit in it. I couldnt roll the sleeping bag, I simply stuffed it into the compression bag and it all fit!!! Then I used the straps and was pleasantly surprised at how compact I was able to get it. My son’s Boy Scout camping trips will be much easier to pack for now!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome storage solutions
customer_reviews.text: I used to sell their products when I worked for a motorcycle shop. They were great then, and still are. I managed to fit my tent, tent floor, and rain fly all inside of this. Compacts well enough for what I need it to compress to.
customer_reviews.author: Frank LiBretto

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff bag in the world? No. Will it get the job done and last, absolutely. I have little to no problems putting my Teton +5F Tracker in this. Construction wise it, feels like it might break under the pressures I have been using it. But so far it has not been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: INEEDIT

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product for the money. It’s water resistant but not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Markos

customer_reviews.title: SHODDY MATERIAL.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Poor craftsmanship. As an avid camper and traveller I decided to buy this stuff sack for a month long trip to Europe. The first time I used it a 4 inch hole along the seam opened up as I put my clothes inside. Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: bucktown

customer_reviews.title: Small Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought a size small and was a little smaller than expected. I couldn't fit my sleeping bag into it, so I bought a medium sized bag and repurposed the small sizer for other gear. Overall, both are great products and I would highly recommend. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: ... traveling abroad or close to home this is a great companion. I use it to pack clothes into ...
customer_reviews.text: When traveling abroad or close to home this is a great companion. I use it to pack clothes into or even dirty clothes and it saves a lot of space in my pack!
customer_reviews.author: ViVi

customer_reviews.title: Good enough compression
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a mummy style sleeping bag for a hiking trip but it ended up being to big to fit in my backpack. This compression bag was able to compress enough to fit in bag. I do recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used this twice so far. Once for clothes and once for a blanket. Works as advertised. Was able to cinch down to at least less than half the size of what was packed both times.
customer_reviews.author: Dmecca83

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't use mine that often but the stitching is already coming apart. Disappointed with the quality. Also, these have very long, cylindrical shape so the mouth/opening of the bag isn't very wide which made it difficult to use at times.
customer_reviews.author: Madelynne Nehl

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I used this compression bag for my DIY hammock, bugnet, tarp, and straps. It has strong straps and compresses everything down into a very compact package. Highly recommend their products, and the carrying strap is nice when packing and unpacking from a backpack
customer_reviews.author: Slader

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like good material
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because it didn't hold what I needed compressed. It seemed like good material. Originally I was going to give it 2 stars but I will update to 3 due to material it was made out of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my sleeping bags came with compression sacks whose straps would not stay taut, they would just slide out after pulling in. These ones get tight and hold that way.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall Stuff Sack
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfect for my old car camping Coleman sleeping bag. the bag is big and bulky and I had no problem fitting the whole bag in this sack. the straps seem to be holding up very well and unlike others I have used the buckles seem well made. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Fits my XL sleeping bag great. I just don't compress it all the way so it fills up the bottom layer of my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Felger

customer_reviews.title: I love them.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and a great solution for those of us who cannot roll a sleeping bag tight enough to fit in the original sleeping bag carrier. I have two of these for our winter super thick bags.The handle is also much more comfortable to carry than pull strings.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Mannion

customer_reviews.title: Works so well for backpacking trips and even travel. ...
customer_reviews.text: Works so well for backpacking trips and even travel. It compresses everything to a dense ball and saves so much space!!
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but a pretty large stuff sack for an ultra lightweight sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great bags for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of this bags, one small and one large. I use the large size for my backpacking sleeping bag, and the small to pack my food - I find it easy to hang while in the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Good for my army surplus patrol "green" bag. Also fits (barely) the cold weather "black" bag. Made of a thinnish fabric, but this bag is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Cantos Evenstar

customer_reviews.title: failed at stiching
customer_reviews.text: I am a scouter with kids - we went on Canada adventure where we need to the compression sacks not to fail. Unfortunately all bags failed at the stitching. I even made sure the boys were using them correctly, then mine even failed. So I would say for occasional canoeing they would be fine, I think?. For the adventurer please this stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A Mazuranic

customer_reviews.title: The small compression bag has ample room for both the ...
customer_reviews.text: The small compression bag has ample room for both the patrol bag and the bivy from the military sleep system; together they compress down to something a bit larger than a basketball. It gets 4 stars instead of 5 because mine came with one of the compression straps twisted, which means I can't get quite as much compression as I should be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: Hard to recommend this product. When I first received it I was very excited as it worked exactly as expected in compressing my sleeping bag down to a reasonable size. However, after four uses I began to see visible strain. On the fifth use a tear formed along one of the seams. It is still usable but I know that within another few uses it will be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Deininger

customer_reviews.title: When it arrived the clips were threaded backward so they ...
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived the clips were threaded backward so they all had to be redone. After correcting that, I found that one of the clips was sewn backwards. It works, but not exactly as intended.
customer_reviews.author: SCVol81

customer_reviews.title: huge improvement to the stuffsack that came with my sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: We lost a stuffsack and tried this one; it's a great improvement on the stuffsack that came with the XLG sleeping bags which would always slowly come open unless you did a special knot... this is much easier to stuff.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: ... reviews saying the compression bag it came with would easily rip. The small is too big for this ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these for my "Naturehike Outdoor Sleeping Bag Camping Sleeping Bag Envelope Sleeping Bag" since I read reviews saying the compression bag it came with would easily rip. The small is too big for this sleeping bag. The diameter is the right size but when you compress it you bottom out without getting it much smaller than the bag it came with. I ended up using it on my Eureka Solitaire with the tent stakes inside and it compresses well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Does s nice job compressing my sleeping bag down
customer_reviews.text: Does s nice job compressing my sleeping bag down. Probably my own fault but the straps get easily twisted up and it takes a minute to get things sorted... wouldn’t stop me from buyin it again tho.
customer_reviews.author: TheJollyGingerGiant

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for your backpack
customer_reviews.text: Best thing for your backpack. I was able to pack 6 outfits with room to spare in this thing and squeeze it down very small. I will bring it on all my trips.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Fran

customer_reviews.title: I had a large sleeping bag without a storage method ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a large sleeping bag without a storage method until now. I'm all set for many years of use and I feel confident it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compression malfunction
customer_reviews.text: The bag has strap issues and does not stay compressed. I have to tie the strap to another strap to keep the bag compressed.
customer_reviews.author: David wiiliams

customer_reviews.title: very happy here. have a big old sleeping bag that ...
customer_reviews.text: well made, fast shipping, not as expensive as kelty but does the same job. very happy here. have a big old sleeping bag that now takes up 1/4 the space it used to, cheap effective, what else can i say? good deal. happy. got 2 and hubbys was just as good....
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Howlett

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: First time I used them the top seam ripped out...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: it would be better to have some bungees for the extra length once ...
customer_reviews.text: My first compression bag thus, I'm unsure how to compare it with others. I tried using it for my sleeping bag, it made me break into a sweat. So far, the only issue I'm displeased with are the straps, it would be better to have some bungees for the extra length once compressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Good Compression sack.  Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: These compression bags turned out to be better than I expected. When I received them, they seemed pretty standard and adequate. THEN, I used them in on a very rainy trip and found out that they are very water resistant - better than some of the more expensive brands. Water just beaded up on the material like a duck feather. These are good bags. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Rave On

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be of good strong construction and the buckles work well
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be of good strong construction and the buckles work well. I fit my ex-long/wide down mummy bag into it easily. When relaxed it is large enough to store the bag for short times. Of course the bag should be hung up for long storage.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product if you are depending on its quality
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke on the first trip. Would not recommend this product if you are depending on its quality.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleUrbanHippie

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, have used it for several trips ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, have used it for several trips and don't plan on traveling without it. Makes plenty of space in my luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Big Little Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great for packing a lot of clothes. I actually had six pair of jeans, eight tee shirts, socks and underwear for a week in this bag with some room to spare. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: KJV

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do a great job compressing my bag either
customer_reviews.text: Far too big and broke after only a few uses. Didn't do a great job compressing my bag either. Although it was cheap, it was a complete waste of money and the sleeping bag compressed better out in the open in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very sturdy. This will work great for my Appalachian trail thru-hike
customer_reviews.author: Ron J.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and son-in-law for their 9 day hike on the PCT. It worked great for them. Easy to use and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: witch

product_meta.title: Nelson-Rigg CB-01-SM Small Compression Bag
product_meta.description: Size:Small| Color:Grey / BlackAllows for the most compact packing of your soft items. Can store upto 30 percent more items after bags are compressed. Great way to separate clean and dirty clothes while on the road. Made from water resistant light weight Tri-Max polyester. Color: Black/Gray; Uncompressed Size: 10L: 18-1/2 inch x 7 inch.
